intro: Rhododendron yedoense var. poukhanense, commonly known as the Japanese azalea, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and produces clusters of showy, funnel-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to gardens and natural landscapes. It prefers acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. The leaves are dark green, leathery, and remain on the plant throughout the growing season.
